reviews.review_msg: I took 105 & 106 with Pearce. He is probably the best profs for those classes, as he did not expect anything serious from students. Be aware of his exams (very tricky MCQ).

Jacquie genuinely cares about her students. She has a lot of experience as a lecturer and an engineer and loves to share her experiences with her class. The information she presents is actually useful and can be easily applied. She does assign a lot of homework and isn't lenient about extensions or anything. Her papers are hard but doable

Horribly unfair teacher. Suspected kids of cheating on quizzes, and so she decided to no longer allow reviewing questions on Canvas, and reduced quiz times from 10 mins to 7 mins, making them almost impossible to finish. If this is the "quality education" SFU is talking about, I don't want it.

This might be the most annoying course I've ever been in. It's like two courses in one, with essays and tests. Essays are marked by a specific rubric, and any small mistake results in a lost mark. Tests are done by memorizing the textbook. Don't know the example on pg 43? Guess that mark is gone now. Easy to get a B, almost impossible get an A.
